description: Expand scenario library from 14 to 112 scenarios covering Foreign Languages, English Communication, Cross-Cultural, Leadership, and Ethics & Philosophy domains. Add language-specific filters and cultural briefing UI.

userStories.title: Create centralized scenario data file with extended interface
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a centralized scenario data file with extended TypeScript interface so scenarios can be managed in one place.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/data/scenarios.ts file
Define Scenario interface with existing fields: id, title, subtitle, course, difficulty, difficultyLevel, description, image, area, courseCode
Add optional language fields: gseLevel (number), cefrLevel (string), actflLevel (string)
Add optional cultural fields: keyVocabulary (string[]), culturalTips (string[]), culturalGotchas (string[])
Add optional detail fields: situation (string), dilemma (string), briefing (string), frameworks (string[]), primaryMission (string), successCriteria (string[]), tags (string[])
Add optional metadata: location (string), role (string), time (string)
Export Scenario type and empty scenarios array
Typecheck passes (npm run build)

userStories.title: Migrate existing 14 scenarios to centralized data file
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to move existing scenarios from MidshipmanScenarios.tsx to the new centralized file.
acceptanceCriteria: Copy all 14 existing scenarios from MidshipmanScenarios.tsx:39-208 to src/data/scenarios.ts
Ensure all image imports are preserved (import from figma:asset paths)
Export scenarios array with all 14 scenarios
Typecheck passes (npm run build)

userStories.title: Create placeholder image component
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a placeholder image component for scenarios without Figma assets.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/components/ScenarioPlaceholderImage.tsx
Component accepts title prop (string)
Uses #E8E6F3 background color
Uses white text (#FFFFFF) centered vertically and horizontally
Uses Plus Jakarta Sans Medium font
Has 288x180 aspect ratio (use aspect-[288/180])
Has rounded-[8px] border radius
Typecheck passes (npm run build)
userStories.notes: Completed 2026-01-22. Created ScenarioPlaceholderImage component with #E8E6F3 background, white centered title, 288x180 aspect ratio, rounded-[8px]. Integrated into MidshipmanScenarios.tsx. 98 scenarios use placeholder images. TypeScript build passes. UI verified with dev-browser.

userStories.title: Add Japanese language scenarios (8 scenarios)
userStories.description: As a midshipman studying Japanese, I want scenarios at each proficiency level.
acceptanceCriteria: Add 8 Japanese scenarios to src/data/scenarios.ts with IDs: fj101-l01-001, fj101-l01-002, fj102-l02-001, fj102-l02-002, fj201-l03-001, fj201-l03-002, fj202-l04-001, fj202-l04-002
Each scenario has area: 'Language', course: 'FJ-101' through 'FJ-202' as appropriate
Each scenario includes gseLevel, cefrLevel (A1/A2/B1/B1+), actflLevel fields
Each scenario includes keyVocabulary, culturalTips, culturalGotchas arrays from docs/new-scenarios/01-foreign-languages/japanese/JAPANESE_SCENARIOS.md
Use null for image field (placeholder will be used)
Typecheck passes (npm run build)

userStories.title: Update MidshipmanScenarios to import from centralized data
userStories.description: As a developer, I need MidshipmanScenarios.tsx to use the centralized scenario data.
acceptanceCriteria: Add import statement: import { scenarios, type Scenario } from '@/data/scenarios'
Remove the inline scenarios array (lines ~39-208)
Keep existing image imports at top of file for now
Existing filtering logic continues to work with imported data
Typecheck passes (npm run build)
UI verified with dev-browser

userStories.title: Update areas and courses filter arrays for new domains
userStories.description: As a user, I need the filter options to include all new scenario domains.
acceptanceCriteria: Update areas array in MidshipmanScenarios.tsx to include: 'Ethics', 'Leadership', 'Philosophy', 'Language', 'Communication', 'Cross-Cultural'
Update courses array to include new course codes: FJ-101, FJ-102, FJ-201, FJ-202 (and similar for FC, FA, FR, FF, FG, FS), HE-111, HE-112, NL-420, NL-360, FAS, NP-232, NP-350, NP-410, NP-430, NP-440
Filter logic continues to work correctly
Typecheck passes (npm run build)
UI verified with dev-browser

userStories.title: Add language filter dropdown to scenario browser
userStories.description: As a midshipman, I want to filter scenarios by language.
acceptanceCriteria: Add selectedLanguages state array using useState<string[]>([])
Add Language filter section after Course filter in sidebar
Languages list: Japanese, Chinese, Arabic, Russian, French, German, Spanish
Add toggleLanguage function similar to toggleArea/toggleCourse pattern
Update filteredScenarios logic to filter by language when selectedLanguages is not empty
Language filter uses same UI pattern as existing course filter
Typecheck passes (npm run build)
UI verified with dev-browser
userStories.notes: Follow existing filter pattern from MidshipmanScenarios.tsx:373-391

userStories.title: Add proficiency level filter to scenario browser
userStories.description: As a midshipman, I want to filter language scenarios by proficiency level.
acceptanceCriteria: Add selectedLevels state array using useState<string[]>([])
Add Proficiency Level filter section after Language filter
Levels list: A1 (Semester 1), A2 (Semester 2), B1 (Semester 3), B1+ (Semester 4)
Add toggleLevel function
Update filteredScenarios logic to filter by cefrLevel when selectedLevels is not empty
Level filter uses same UI pattern as existing filters
Typecheck passes (npm run build)
UI verified with dev-browser

userStories.title: Add CEFR level badge to scenario cards
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see proficiency level badges on language scenario cards.
acceptanceCriteria: Scenario cards conditionally display CEFR level badge when scenario.cefrLevel exists
Badge appears in the same row as difficulty badge
Badge uses difficulty badge color pattern: bg-[#ffebd6] text-[#793c00]
Badge structure matches existing badge pattern from design system
Typecheck passes (npm run build)
UI verified with dev-browser

userStories.title: Update scenario card to use placeholder for null images
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see placeholder images for scenarios without Figma assets.
acceptanceCriteria: Import ScenarioPlaceholderImage component in MidshipmanScenarios.tsx
Update card rendering: if scenario.image is null, render ScenarioPlaceholderImage with scenario.title
If scenario.image exists, render existing img element
Placeholder displays correctly for language scenarios
Typecheck passes (npm run build)
UI verified with dev-browser

userStories.title: Add cultural briefing section to SimulationBriefing
userStories.description: As a midshipman starting a language scenario, I want to see cultural preparation content.
acceptanceCriteria: Add Cultural Preparation section to SimulationBriefing.tsx
Section only renders when scenario has keyVocabulary field with at least one item
Section includes Key Vocabulary subsection listing vocabulary items
Section includes Cultural Tips subsection with checkmark-style list
Section includes Cultural Gotchas subsection with warning-style list
Uses existing card/section styling patterns from SimulationBriefing
Typecheck passes (npm run build)
UI verified with dev-browser
